content: If you prefer minimal staff interaction, you may request a low contact stay, which limits housekeeping knock attempts and front desk outreach. This option is useful for guests who value privacy or rest during daylight hours.
Guests may opt out of daily housekeeping and receive fresh towels and amenities on request instead. This option supports both privacy and sustainability initiatives across all locations.
If you are sensitive to mirrors, you may request mirror covers or reduced reflective surfaces in your room. Availability varies by room type, but staff will do their best to accommodate.
All locations offer complimentary filtered water refill stations on each guest floor. Guests who prefer bottled options may request glass bottled water delivery to their room.
If you are traveling with fragile artifacts or heirlooms, the front desk can arrange temporary secure storage. Items are logged, sealed, and accessible only with guest verification.
Guests participating in overnight events may request delayed quiet hour enforcement on designated event floors only. All other floors continue to observe standard quiet hours.
If you are traveling across time zones, the concierge can help plan gradual schedule shifts to avoid daylight exposure fatigue. This service is complimentary and tailored to your itinerary.
Rooms are inspected after checkout for damage beyond normal wear. If damage is found, charges may apply, and the guest will be contacted with photo documentation.
If you need a temporary room extension due to travel delays, the front desk can quote an hourly or half day rate when availability allows. Extensions are not guaranteed during high occupancy.
For guests with hearing sensitivity, visual alerts can replace audible alarms in guestrooms. This includes light based wake up calls and emergency notifications.
If you are celebrating an anniversary or centuries long partnership, mention it at booking and we can note the occasion. Small acknowledgments may be arranged based on availability.
Guests may request scent free rooms, where cleaning products and amenities are selected to minimize fragrance. This is recommended for guests with scent sensitivity.
If a guest fails to check out by the confirmed time without approval, a late departure fee may apply. The front desk will attempt contact before applying any charges.
All properties maintain 24 hour security monitoring in public spaces. Guestroom corridors are accessible only by key card for added safety.
If you prefer not to be disturbed at all, you may activate extended privacy mode, which suppresses non essential staff visits. Emergency access is still retained for safety reasons.
For guests arriving by motorcycle, broomstick, or non standard transport, storage options may be available depending on location. Call ahead for guidance before arrival.
If you require a translator or interpreter, the concierge can arrange language support services with advance notice. Availability depends on language and time of day.
Rooms with fireplaces or heat stones are limited and must be requested in advance. These features are monitored for safety and may not be available for all pet types.
If you need to print boarding passes or travel documents, printing is available at the business center. Small print jobs are typically complimentary.
Guests who violate safety or conduct policies may be asked to relocate rooms or leave the property without refund. These situations are handled discreetly whenever possible.
San Francisco offers early morning coffee and tea service starting at 5:30 AM for guests departing on sunrise flights. Beverages are served in low light areas for comfort.
If you plan to explore Fisherman’s Wharf, ask the concierge about walking routes that avoid steep hills. This is especially helpful for guests with mobility considerations.
San Francisco tech travelers often request additional power outlets and monitor connections. These items can be delivered to your room when available.
During major city events, downtown traffic may impact airport transfers. The concierge can help adjust pickup times to reduce stress on departure day.
If fog conditions become heavy, some Golden Gate views may be partially obscured. The front desk can suggest alternate scenic viewpoints within the city.
New York guests who prefer minimal street exposure can request indoor navigation guidance between nearby attractions. This is helpful during extreme weather or heavy crowds.
If you are attending multiple Broadway shows, concierge can help stagger showtimes and dining to avoid fatigue. This service is especially popular with older vampire guests.
New York winters can bring sudden temperature drops, so request extra blankets or a warmer room setting if needed. Our HVAC team can adjust settings within safe ranges.
If you are flying out of JFK early, the front desk can help arrange a pre dawn transfer and breakfast to go. Advance notice helps ensure availability.
Times Square crowds are densest between 7:00 PM and 10:00 PM. Visiting earlier or later can provide a calmer experience for guests with pets or children.
Chicago offers complimentary snow removal from guest vehicles during winter storms. This service is automatic and does not require a request.
If you are visiting during festival season, downtown areas may be busier than usual. The front desk can suggest alternative dining and sightseeing routes.
Wind conditions can vary quickly in Chicago, especially near the lake. Guests with winged pets may want to avoid rooftop access during high wind advisories.
Chicago’s lobby often hosts casual evening social hours on non event nights. These gatherings are informal and open to all registered guests.
If you are traveling with children, Millennium Park is one of the most family friendly nearby attractions. Concierge can recommend best visiting times to avoid crowds.
